comment: Dr. D was a great professor. I had him for lecture and lab and he was always very attentive, clear, and understanding. Going to class, working out the examples, and putting time into the topics he says to cover will definitely get you an A. He is lenient with grading and always curves if the class really needs it. Highly recommend him!

He is a very good teacher! Not over-demanding and he makes the grading material clear. If you take notes, you have a very good chance of getting the grade you want. He also has a good amount of office hours if you need help.

While Physics is hard, Dr. D makes an effort to make it easier on his students. He is very lenient, curved all of our lab exams, even adding points to our final grades, met up outside of class hours to help you understand, just a very overall caring professor. He could grade lab reports much harder, but really just wants you to understand & succeed

Let's be honest, physics is a hard subject but this professor goes the extra mile to try to help you understand it. It is college folks so like most teachers they expect you to do homework and study. If I had to take it again I would choose him again.

Dr. D is fantastic! He's got a very slight accent but easy to understand. His tests come right off the review sheets in recitation. Practice those sheets, understand the concepts, and you'll make an easy "A".  More than that, he loves to help and really wants  you to succeed. A darling professor.

Professor Dayananda is a very fair professor. He is willing to help you receive a good grade in his class and wants you to succeed. My only complaint is that he is a little inexperienced as a professor, but for such a complicated subject he does a great job. Make sure you go to his recitations since they are intended as preperation for his exams.
For a new professor, this professor will rock your socks off Physics 2. He just needs some time under his belt.
He's a very good teacher, which honestly seems to be rare at SPSU. He truly wants everyone to do well and is always willing to help. I would definitely recommend taking him.

He was not a super clear teacher but from what I have heard he is one of the best Physics Teachers at SPSU. He curved a couple of tests where the entire class did poorly. Many of his questions were taken from examples he did in class, attendance was not mandatory but makes getting a good grade easy. He wants you to succeed and learn.

Fall 2013: He explained what needed to be done at the beginning of lab which was very helpful in learning. He has a slight accent but it was never a problem. He was always eager to help us understand the material. He grades the lab fairly.
